alert.note: Alert for Macon; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 11:52AM EST until February 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by high runoff continues. * WHERE...A portion of Macon and Swain counties. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM EST, High levels of runoff will continue throughout the Little Tennessee basin through this afternoon. Above bankfull conditions, and flooding of low-lying areas near the river will linger. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Franklin, Fontana Lake, Burningtown, Cowee, Luada and Almond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
